free_text.Form of examination: 40 % spot check durant the semester[br/]60 % written test (120 min) during exam session
free_text.Bibliography and material: Class notes and document from the Swiss Federal Office for Environment
free_text.Prerequisite for: Specialization in Environmental chemistry and bioprocesses
free_text.Content: [b]Contaminated site management[/b][br/]Registration of polluted sites, preliminary and detailed investigation, remediation[br/][b]Remediation techniques[/b][br/]Physical methods by evacuation and trapping, chemical, thermal and biological methods[br/][b]Choice of a decontamination process[/b][br/]Technical and economical criteria, environmental diagnosis[br/][b]Evaluation of the treatment process[/b] Laboratory studies, pilot-scale tests on site, quantitative and qualitative analysis on site[br/][b]Groundwater Flow and Solute Transport Modeling[/b][br/]Revision of aquifer flow and solute transport theory, numerical modeling of flow and transport, MOD-FLOW/MT3DMS model applications[br/][br/][br/]
free_text.Keywords: Contaminated site management, remediation techniques, NAPL, MODFLOW, groundwater remediation design
free_text.Learning outcomes: [br/][li]Knowledge of the principles of contaminated sites management in Switzerland[br/][li]Knowledge of the different physico-chemical, chemical and biological techniques to remediate soils and aquifers[br/][li]Knowledge of the global approach for the selec-tion and application of a treatment process at a site[br/][li]Knowledge and application of groundwater modeling for site remediation
